preferences.title: My preferences
preferences.subtitle: Language and workspace layout (saved per user). Currency is managed in company settings.
preferences.note: Note: this is the persistence layer. Next, the UI will use locale for formatting, and workspace layout for reduced-click workflows.
preferences.layout_subtitle: Temporary editor until drag-and-drop widgets are wired in.

itineraries.title: Itineraries
itineraries.subtitle: Manage reusable itineraries (multilingual titles + day-by-day port/sea plan). Import from Excel, create new ones, and preview/compute dates.

list.panel_subtitle: Search and select an itinerary to see details on the right.
list.search_placeholder: Search by code / title / ports / id…

details.panel_subtitle: Select one to compute dates or to use when creating sailings.
details.sub_subtitle_selected: Preview stops and compute end date for a given start date.
details.sub_subtitle_none: Select an itinerary from the list to see details.
details.compute_label: Compute end date from start date
details.stops_subtitle: Ports are resolved via Ports screen by port code.
details.confirm_delete: Are you sure you want to delete this itinerary?

form.subtitle_new: Tip: start with titles (he/en), then add day-by-day stops.
form.map_hint: Required. This is the itinerary overview route/map image.
form.titles_subtitle: Only he + en are supported for itinerary titles.
form.stops_subtitle: Day offsets are saved contiguously starting at 0. Port days require port code and image URL.
form.sea_day_note: Sea day: no port code/time fields.
form.port_hint_picker: Pick a managed port code (localized name/city/country come from Ports screen).
form.port_hint_manual: No managed ports yet. Create ports first to enable the picker.

import.title: Import from Excel
import.subtitle: Download the template, fill it out, then upload to create itineraries in bulk.
import.note: Sheets required: <1>itineraries</1> and <3>stops</3>. Default languages are <5>he</5> + <7>en</7>.
import.empty_preview: Upload an Excel file to see a preview.
import.nothing_to_import: Nothing to import (no itineraries with stops).
